dt: {bc}to rework in order to improve {bc}{sx|touch up||}
{bc}to alter (something, such as a photographic negative) to produce a more desirable appearance
{bc}to color (new growth of hair) to match previously dyed, tinted, or bleached hair

et: French {it}retoucher{/it}, from Middle French, from {it}re-{/it} + {it}toucher{/it} to touch
shortdef: to rework in order to improve : touch up
to alter (something, such as a photographic negative) to produce a more desirable appearance
to color (new growth of hair) to match previously dyed, tinted, or bleached hair
